snippet: Nicholas A. Spano took advantage of an arcane provision in the law to collect roughly $1 million in consulting payments from a politically connected insurance brokerage, prosecutors said.
abstract: Former New York State Sen Nicholas A Spano pleads guilty to obstructing the Internal Revenue Service by filing fraudulent tax returns, and faces up to three years in prison when he is sentenced in June; because Spano was defeated in 2006, he is unlikely to face any state ethics charges.

byline.original: By WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM and DANNY HAKIM

lead_paragraph: Nicholas A. Spano took advantage of an arcane provision in the law to collect roughly $1 million in consulting payments from a politically connected insurance brokerage, prosecutors said.

headline.seo: Nicholas Spano, Ex-State Senator, Pleads Guilty to Tax Obstruction
